attributes.action: Stop Lawyers, (Solicitors, their family members and staff) from witnessing wills
attributes.additional_details: Solicitors are failing to seek and get a medical check on elderly clients (especially new clients) and changing (replacing existing wills) to the advantage of individuals who are seeking a greater share / advantage of the execution of said will.
attributes.background: Declare any will witnessed by a solicitor, their staff or family members to be null and void

rejection.details:
In order to be valid a will must be:

- made by someone aged 18 or over
- made voluntarily
- made by someone of sound mind
- made in writing
- signed it in the presence of 2 witnesses who are both over 18
- signed by the 2 witnesses, in the presence of whoever's will it is

Deciding whether a will is valid is a matter for the courts, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you believe a will is not legally valid, and wish to challenge this, you should seek legal advice.
